text: Military Council for Angolan Resistance (; COMIRA) was a militant organization that fought in the Angolan Civil War in the 1980s. The militant wing of the National Liberation Front of Angola (FNLA) created COMIRA on August 12, 1980. P. Tuba and H. V. Nato led COMIRA upon its creation. COMIRA leaders said they overthrew FNLA leader Holden Roberto on September 15, 1980 in Paris, France, making the FNLA a part of COMIRA. ==See also== *UNITA *MPLA ==References== Category:Angolan Civil War Category:African and Black nationalist organizations in Africa Category:Military history of Angola Category:National Liberation Front of Angola Category:Rebel groups in Angola
title: Military Council for Angolan Resistance
